title: AI in Financial Services
subtitle: Fraud Detection, Risk Assessment, and Regulatory Compliance
description: Master AI implementation in financial services with focus on fraud detection, risk assessment, algorithmic compliance, and regulatory requirements. Designed for finance professionals navigating the intersection of AI innovation and strict regulatory oversight.
prerequisites: Working knowledge of financial services operations
Basic understanding of risk management concepts
Familiarity with financial regulations (helpful but not required)
learning_objectives: Design and implement AI-powered fraud detection systems with explainable outputs
Build compliant AI models for credit risk assessment and lending decisions
Navigate financial regulations (GDPR, AI Act, CCPA, Fair Lending) in AI deployments
Implement model governance frameworks meeting regulatory expectations
Assess and mitigate bias in financial AI applications

modules.title: AI Fundamentals for Finance
modules.description: Understanding AI/ML technologies in financial services context
lessons: Machine Learning Basics for Financial Professionals
AI Applications Across Banking, Insurance, and Investments
The AI Advantage: Speed, Scale, and Pattern Recognition
Limitations and Risks: When AI Gets It Wrong in Finance

modules.title: Fraud Detection and AML
modules.description: AI-powered fraud prevention and anti-money laundering systems
lessons: Traditional vs. AI-Based Fraud Detection
Real-Time Transaction Monitoring Systems
Network Analysis for Fraud Ring Detection
AML and Know Your Customer (KYC) AI Applications
False Positive Management and Alert Prioritization
Case Study: Major Bank Fraud Detection Implementation

modules.title: Credit Risk and Lending AI
modules.description: Fair and compliant AI for credit decisions
lessons: AI in Credit Scoring: Beyond Traditional Models
Alternative Data Sources and Their Implications
Fair Lending Compliance: ECOA, Fair Housing Act
Adverse Action Notices and Model Explainability
Model Validation and Backtesting Requirements
Regulatory Expectations for Credit AI (OCC, Fed)

modules.title: Regulatory Compliance Framework
modules.description: Meeting regulatory requirements for AI in finance
lessons: EU AI Act Impact on Financial Services
GDPR and Automated Decision-Making Rights
SR 11-7: Model Risk Management Guidance
SEC and FINRA AI Guidance for Investments
Insurance Regulatory Considerations
Cross-Border Compliance Challenges

modules.title: Algorithmic Trading and Investment AI
modules.description: AI in investment management and trading operations
lessons: AI-Powered Trading Strategies and Market Making
Robo-Advisory and Wealth Management AI
Risk Monitoring and Portfolio Optimization
Market Manipulation Detection

modules.title: Model Governance and Operations
modules.description: Enterprise governance framework for financial AI
lessons: Model Risk Management Framework Design
Model Inventory and Documentation Standards
Independent Model Validation Practices
Ongoing Monitoring and Model Decay Detection
Audit Trails and Regulatory Examination Prep

certification.name: Certified Financial AI Professional (CFAIP)
requirements: Complete all 6 modules with minimum 80% assessment score
Submit capstone project: AI Use Case with Compliance Documentation
Pass final comprehensive examination (80 questions, 75% minimum)
certification.renewal: 24 continuing education hours including regulatory updates

includes: Access to financial AI professionals network

tools: Bias Testing Framework for Lending Models

regulatory_alignment: EU AI Act - High-Risk AI Systems (Credit Scoring)
OCC Supervisory Guidance on Model Risk Management
ECOA and Regulation B - Fair Lending
CCPA/CPRA - Consumer Rights for Automated Decisions
